intro: Corydalis straminea var. straminea, commonly known as the yellow larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
